Framing the Future of Web 3.0

The global Internet is in the middle to late innings of the innovation curve of Web 2.0, and we see the potential for dramatic shifts in industry structure with Web 3.0, which could impact current investor perceptions of platform moat/strength, industry input costs, possible headwinds to monetization driven by personalization and potential for shifting media & commerce trends.

Key Concepts:

  • The global Internet is in the middle to late innings of the innovation curve of Web 2.0.
  • The next wave of computing (Web 3.0) could bring dramatic shifts in industry structure.
  • Decentralized, more local/niche/targeted industry structures may impact current investor perceptions.
  • Hanke's thesis on real-world Metaverse
  • synchronizing millions of users globally (shared state)
  • tying users to the physical world
  • Metaverse as a 3D extension of the internet
  • virtual economy vs. real-world economy
